text.text: 1956/2054 is a mobile application that complements American Artist's exhibition called "My Blue Window" at Queens Museum. "My Blue Window" considers the predatorial nature of predictive policing systems that are currently used by many police departments across the country (including the NYPD). This app includes additional resources about predictive policing and, specifically, allows people with the app to stay up-to-date on news articles about predictive policing curated by American Artist. The title of the app is a reference to Philip K. Dick's 1956 science fiction novel "Minority Report". Set in the year 2054, the novel foretold the use of predictive policing as well as the faultiness of it's predictions.
1956/2054 is currently available on the Google Play app store.
